starvationevasion.common

Interface PolicyCard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Fall2015PolicyProvider.EnumPolicy

    public interface PolicyCard
    PolicyCard is the structure that the Simulator maintains for each card in the deck.

    When a card is played it becomes a Policy for voting and implementation purposes. The game client's might want to implement a class adding, for example, an image, a status (in deck, in hand, proposed, voting, enacted, rejected) and other data.
    If the client does extend this class, be sure to downcast to Policy before sending across the network to the server.

    Use the validate() method to verify all needed parameters of the policy are defined and in range.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        java.lang.String name()
        Returns:
        the policy card name.

      • title

        java.lang.String title()
        Returns:
        the policy card title text.

      • gameText

        java.lang.String gameText()
        Returns:
        the policy card game text.

      • votesRequired

        int votesRequired()
        Returns:
        0 if the policy is automatic. Otherwise, returns the number of votes required for the policy to be enacted.

      • voteWaitForAll

        boolean voteWaitForAll()
        Returns:
        true if voting should continue until all eligible players have voted on this policy. Return false if voting should stop as soon as the required number of votes have been reached.

      • validTargetRegions

        java.util.Collection<EnumRegion> validTargetRegions()
        Returns:
        A collection of applicable target regions if this card requires a target region, or null if no regions apply.

      • validTargetFoods

        java.util.Collection<EnumFood> validTargetFoods()
        Returns:
        The target food types required by this card, or null if no types apply.
